paper: Two-Way Garment Transfer_ Unified Diffusion Framework for Dressing and Undressing Synthesis

differences.summary: Truncated mask-handling sentence introduces inference ambiguity
differences.why_impacts_score: reduces clarity and reproducibility of the core pipeline

evidence.baseline_quote: Figure 2(a)-(c) are referenced, but mapping to UNet tensors is unclear.
evidence.final_quote: Text includes a truncated mask sentence ('mask zeros(M)') leaving inference usage unclear.

differences.summary: TFQ resolution inconsistency vs. multi-scale definitions
differences.why_impacts_score: signals internal inconsistency in method specification

evidence.baseline_quote: TFQ dimensions across scales are not fully specified.
evidence.final_quote: Claim of 'same resolution' conflicts with multi-scale 1/4, 1/8, 1/16 definitions.

differences.summary: Best ablation variant (Mask2BBox) not adopted or justified
differences.why_impacts_score: undermines configuration fairness and metric-driven justification

evidence.baseline_quote: Variants removing SRM or QFormer degrade performance—good experimental rigor.
evidence.final_quote: Variant 3 achieves better DISTS (0.174) than default (0.195) but is not adopted or discussed.

differences.why_impacts_score: casts doubt on correctness of qualitative evidence

evidence.baseline_quote: Caption says 'VTON results,' inconsistent with text referencing VTOFF.
evidence.final_quote: Caption says 'VTON' while visuals depict VTOFF reconstruction of flat garments.

differences.summary: Missing Figure 2(a) and ambiguous latent-to-UNet mapping

evidence.baseline_quote: Unclear how 'latent space input processing' aligns with UNet tensors.
evidence.final_quote: Figure 2 mentions (a) input processing, but only (b)–(c) provided; mapping remains ambiguous.
